title: Systematic Instructional Design for Understanding Fraction-Decimal Relationships

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Fraction Concepts and Number Systems, with Basic LMS Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Explicit instructional methods applied for diverse learners, including those with learning disabilities, optimizing smartphone-based learning activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of converting fractions to decimals using the division model with over 85% accuracy.
Apply a systematic 4-stage learning sequence to independently solve fraction-decimal relationship problems
Identify and implement at least three differentiated instructional strategies for students with learning disabilities, including action planning

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
